vercellae: <entryFree id="n50524" type="main" key="Vercellae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vercellae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50524.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in</hi> Gallia Cisalpina, now <hi rend="ital">Borgo Vercelli</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 17, 21, § 124</bibl>; Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 19, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 70</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n50524.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vercellensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Vercellœ</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 78</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50524.2" n="B" level="2"> ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vercellīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Vercellœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Vercelline</hi>: PORTA, Inscr. Marin. Fratr. Arv. p. 772. <pb n="1973" /> <cb n="VERE" /></sense></entryFree>
vercingetorix: <entryFree id="n50525" type="main" key="Vercingeto^rix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vercingetŏrix</orth>, <itype>ĭgis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50525.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a commander of the Gauls in the Gallic War</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:4 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 4 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:10:20" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 10, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
verculum: <entryFree id="n50526" type="hapax" key="vercu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vercŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>ver</etym>, <sense id="n50526.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">little spring</hi>, as a term of endearment: <cit><quote lang="la">meum corculum, melliculum, verculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vere: <entryFree id="n50527" type="main" key="ve_re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vērē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. verus, C. <sense id="n50527.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
verecunde: <entryFree id="n50528" type="main" key="ve^re_cunde_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕrēcundē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. verecundus, II. <foreign lang="greek">a.</foreign></entryFree>
verecundia: <entryFree id="n50529" type="main" key="ve^re_cundi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕrēcundĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>verecundus</etym>, <sense id="n50529.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the natural feeling of shame</hi>, by whatever cause produced, <hi rend="ital">shamefacedness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bashfulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shyness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coyness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">modesty</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n50529.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (class.; syn.: pudicitia, castitas, pudor). </sense><sense id="n50529.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero tam metu poenāque terrentur, quae est constituta legibus, quam verecundiā, quam natura homini dedit quasi quendam vituperationis non injustae timorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:5:4:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 5, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo solum animal natum pudoris ac verecundiae particeps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:7:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scenicorum mos tantam habet veteri disciplina verecundiam, ut in scaenam sine subligaculo prodeat nemo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:35:129" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 35, 129</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:4:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 4, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnam habet vim disciplina verecundiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: justitiae partes sunt non violare homines; <cit><quote lang="la">verecundiae non offendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:28:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 28, 99</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:22:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 22, 82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar meam in rogando verecundiam objurgavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:3:section=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 3, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tironis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo timidus, virginali verecundiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 11, 39</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">virginalis, Suet. Vit. Pers.: fuit sponsa tua apud me eādem, quā apud parentis suos, verecundiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:50:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 50, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verecundia nostra adversus regem nobis obstat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:54:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 54, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nova nupta verecundiā notabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verecundia oris,</quote> <trans><tr>bashful redness</tr>, <tr>blushing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50529.3" n="B" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50529.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. rei</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpitudinis verecundia,</quote> <trans><tr>dread of wrong-doing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:26:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 26, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:71:238" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 71, 238</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Quint. prooem. § 3: respondendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:50:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 50, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50529.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. personae</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. period): <cit><quote lang="la">quando nec ordinis hujus ulla, nec reipublicae est verecundia,</quote> <trans><tr>respect for</tr>, <tr>reverence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:45:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 45, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parentis, vitrici, deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne auctorem ponam, verecundia ipsius facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:64" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majestatis magistratuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:36:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 36, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 3, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 13, 8</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam ita sunt receptae auctoritatis ac notae verecundiae, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of known venerableness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50529.6" n="II" level="1"> In partic., with an implication of censure. </sense><sense id="n50529.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Over-shyness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bashfulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sheepishness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">timidity</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">verecundia vitium quidem sed amabile et quae virtutes facillime generet ... quae (verecundia) est timor quidam reducens animum ab iis, quae facienda sunt ... Optima est autem emendatio verecundiae fiducia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:5:2 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 5, 2 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patronus timet cognoscentis verecundiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vox) in metu et verecundiā contracta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50529.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A shame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgrace</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verecundiae erat equitem suo alienoque Marte pugnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:62:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 62, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verecundia Romanos tandem cepit, Saguntum sub hostium potestate esse, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>a sense of shame</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:42:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 42, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
verecunditer: <entryFree id="n50530" type="main" key="ve^re_cundi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕrēcundĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. verecundus <sense id="n50530.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>.</sense></entryFree>
verecundor: <entryFree id="n50531" type="main" key="ve^re_cundor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕrēcundor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n50531.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [verecundus], <hi rend="ital">to feel bashful</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ashamed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be shy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">diffident</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">verecundari neminem apud mensam decet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 77</bibl></cit>: hi nostri amici verecundantur, capti splendore virtutis, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 480, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem cunctantem et quasi verecundantem incitare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 9, 36</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sp. Carvilio graviter claudicanti ex vulnere ... et ob eam causam verecundanti in publicum prodire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:61:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 61, 249</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50531.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">(manus) probant, admirantur, verecundantur,</quote> <trans><tr>express shame</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:87" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 87</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
verecundus: <entryFree id="n50532" type="main" key="ve^re_cundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕrēcundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vereor</etym>, <sense id="n50532.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">feeling shame</hi> (at any thing good or bad), <hi rend="ital">shamefaced</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bashful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">modest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diffident</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n50532.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis verecunda es (uxor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decet verecundum esse adulescentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 5, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo non nimis verecundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:88:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 88, 361</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">misi ad te quattuor admonitores non nimis verecundos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">innocentes et verecundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:19:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 19, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 207</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe verecundum laudasti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 37</bibl></cit>: Bacchus, <hi rend="ital">moderate</hi>, <cb n="VERE" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 27, 3</bibl> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">modicus Liber,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18, 7</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">orator in transferendis verecundus et parcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:24:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 24, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:840" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 840</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ore loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:1:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <trans><tr>a blush</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:21" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:484" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 484</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:4:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 4, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verecunda debet esse translatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:41:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 41, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:96" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:354" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 354</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">subj.clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">transire in diversa subsellia, parum verecundum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:133" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc dicere verecundum est,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>I am ashamed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 1, 56</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verecundior in postulando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verecundior in loquendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 33, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the private parts</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">translatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confessio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompejus in appetendis honoribus immodicus, in gerendis verecundissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:33:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 33, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50532.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, objectively, <hi rend="ital">worthy of reverence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venerable</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">nomen populi Romani,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 21, 16, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">30, 8, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Ver. 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> (acc. to I.), <hi rend="ital">shamefacedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bashfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shyly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">modestly.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50532.3" n="(a)" level="5"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕrēcundē</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:22:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 22, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:49:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 49, 16</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n50532.4" n="(b)" level="5"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕrēcundĭter</orth>, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 516, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50532.5" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verecundius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:37:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 37, 171</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:84" default="NO">11, 1, 84</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
veredarius: <entryFree id="n50533" type="main" key="ve^re_da_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕrēdārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>veredus</etym>, <sense id="n50533.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a postboy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courier</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 7 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,019:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Esth. 8, 10</bibl>; Firm. Math. 3, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 9</bibl>.—Comically, of a priest eager for gossip, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 22, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
veredus: <entryFree id="n50534" type="main" key="ve^re_dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕrēdus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n50534.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A light horse</hi> for posting, <hi rend="ital">a post-horse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courier's horse</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 51, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 51, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 8, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50534.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fleet huntinghorse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:14:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:86:1" default="NO">14, 86, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
verendus: <entryFree id="n50535" type="main" key="ve^rendus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕrendus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. vereor, B. <sense id="n50535.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
verenter: <entryFree id="n50536" type="main" key="ve^renter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕrenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. vereor, A. <sense id="n50536.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vereor: <entryFree id="n50537" type="main" key="ve^re^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕrĕor</orth>, <itype>ĭtus</itype> (<sense id="n50537.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi> verens; rare in histt.; not in Cæs., Liv., Sall., or Curt., veritus being used instead; but freq. in Cic., Nep., and Just.; cf. Krebs, Antibarb. p. 1192), 2, <hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Greek root <foreign lang="greek">or-, vor; ou)=ros, e)pi/ouros</foreign>, guardian; <foreign lang="greek">o(ra/w</foreign>, to see; O. H. Germ. warten, to see; Engl. ward</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to feel awe of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to reverence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respect; to fear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be afraid of</hi> any thing (good or bad); <hi rend="ital">to fear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">be afraid</hi> to do a thing, etc. (not so strong as metuo, v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 1, 1</bibl> infra; cf. also timeo); constr. with <case>acc.</case>, with an <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, a foll. <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, a <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50537.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vereri aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 23</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vereri et metuere Junonem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 202</bibl></cit>: contra nos ambae faciunt, summa gratia et eloquentia; <cit><quote lang="la">quarum alteram vereor, alteram metuo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metuebant eum servi, verebantur liberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:11:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 11, 37</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid? veteranos non veremur? nam timeri se ne ipsi quidem volunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veremur vos, Romani, et, si ita vultis, etiam timemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:37:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 37, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut majorem fratrem vereri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem discipuli et amant et verentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 8</bibl></cit> Spald. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non se hostem vereri, sed angustias itineris et magnitudinem silvarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patris conspectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reprehensionem doctorum atque prudentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallica bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:39" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">desidiam in hoc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinionem jactantiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauperiem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 8, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicium ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 19, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc verens in hanc tarditatem incidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae verens Epicurus ... commentus est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:23:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 23, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiam verens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50537.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vereri introire in alienam domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vereor dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vereor committere, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:13:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos interficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insanos qui inter vereare insanus haberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verear magis, Me amoris causā hoc ornatu incedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judex verebar non omnes causam vincere posse suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:75 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 75 sq.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cyrenaici, quos non est veritum in voluptate summum bonum ponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:13:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 13, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50537.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (mostly ante-class.): uxor, quae non vereatur viri, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 496, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tui progenitoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:ib. 497:2" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> ib. 497, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feminae primariae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tui testimonii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: nihilne te populi veretur, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 497, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50537.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> <cb n="VERG" /> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">eo minus veritus navibus, quod, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>for the ships</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 9</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lest</hi> or <hi rend="ital">that</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed vereor, ne videatur oratio mea, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:46:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 46, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 5, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:55:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 55, 234</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:23:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 23, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 127</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritus, ne licentia invidiam adcenderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agebamus verentes ne quid accideret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum me inquit collegi, verens ne ... noceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 21, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or 2, 3, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 9, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Them. 5, 1</bibl>.—To introduce an expression of opinion, like dubito an: <cit><quote lang="la">si, ut Graeci dicunt, omnes aut Graios esse aut barbaros, vereor ne barbarorum rex fuerit (Romulus),</quote> <trans><tr>then I am afraid that</tr>, <tr>I suspect that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:37:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 37, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non vereor, ne assentatiunculā quādam aucupari tuam gratiam videar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 7, 1</bibl>; Matius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 28, 8</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ne ... non</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">accepi tuas litteras, quibus intellexi te vereri ne superiores mihi redditae non essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—So usu. after non vereor, ne non is used instead of ut (cf. <foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>, infra): <cit><quote lang="la">non vereor ne hoc officium meum P. Servilio non probem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:38:section=82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 38, § 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 47, § 118</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non vereor, ne non scribendo te expleam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 2</bibl>; 11, 28, 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 12</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">So after questions implying a negative: quid est cur verear ne ad eam non possim accommodare Torquatos nostros?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:10:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 10, 34</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in ironical concessions or assumptions: si meis horis in accusando uti voluissem, vererer ne mihi crimina non suppeterent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:11:section=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 11, § 31</bibl></cit>; id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 19</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that not</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritus ut hostium impetum sustinere posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa duo, Crasse, vereor, ut tibi possim concedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:9:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 9, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:22:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 22, 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 6, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ferulā caedas meritum majora subire Verbera non vereor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 121</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) With a <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to await with fear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dread</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">heri semper lenitas verebar quorsum evaderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pomptinum quod scribis in urbem introisse, vereor, quid sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: hoc quomodo acciperent homines, vereor etiam nunc, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 10, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vereor, num hic aliud sit dicendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:4:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 20, 4, 11</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">i</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">de</hi> and <case>abl.</case> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">de quā (Carthagine) vereri non ante desinam quam illam excisam esse cognovero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 6, 18</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">k</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic vereri perdidit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>he has lost all sense of shame</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne vereamini, Quia bellum Aetolis esse dixi cum Aliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. prol. 58</bibl></cit>: ne vereare; <cit><quote lang="la">meo periculo hujus ego experiar fidem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 99</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n50537.5" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕrenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">with reverence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reverently</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 1, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50537.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕrendus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">that is to be feared</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reverenced</hi>, <hi rend="ital">awful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venerable; fearful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terrible</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n50537.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">majestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:540" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 540</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:143" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 1, 143</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:6:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 6, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa (viri),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexander Partho verendus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctus classibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:502" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 502</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50537.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕrenda</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the private parts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 15, 60, § 213</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:107" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 9, 34, § 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:156" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 21, 42, § 156</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:18:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 18, 14</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also partes verendae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 7</bibl></cit>.!*? In a <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif.: ubi malunt metui quam vereri se ab suis, Afran. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:13:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 13, 3</bibl>; cf. also the impersonal use above, <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">g</foreign>.</sense></entryFree>
veretillum: <entryFree id="n50538" type="main" key="ve^re_tillum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕrētillum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>veretrum</etym>, = parvum veretrum, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 296, 28</bibl>.</entryFree>
veretini: <entryFree id="n50539" type="main" key="Vereti_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Veretīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50539.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Calabria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
veretrum: <entryFree id="n50540" type="main" key="ve^re_trum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕrētrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vereor; cf. verendus, 2.</etym>, <sense id="n50540.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the private parts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:62" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 62</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 165</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">muliebre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:10:16" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 10, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 234" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 234</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 201</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vergellus: <entryFree id="n50541" type="main" key="Vergellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vergellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50541.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Apulia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 2</bibl>, ext. 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:18" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vergentum: <entryFree id="n50542" type="main" key="Vergentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vergentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n50542.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in</hi> Hispania Baetica, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vergiliae: <entryFree id="n50543" type="main" key="Vergi^li^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vergĭlĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vergo</etym>, <sense id="n50543.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the constellation of the seven stars</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that rises at the end of spring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Pleiades</hi>, Cic. N. D. poët. 2, 44, 112; Auct. B. Afr. 47; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 3, 70</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=372" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 372</bibl> Müll. <pb n="1974" /> <cb n="VERI" /></sense></entryFree>
vergiliocento: <entryFree id="n50544" type="main" key="Vergi^li^ocento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vergĭlĭo-cento</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Vergiliuscento</etym>, <sense id="n50544.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a poem made up of scraps from Vergil</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 103, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vergilius: <entryFree id="n50545" type="main" key="Vergi^li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vergĭlĭus</orth> (not <orth extent="full" lang="la">Virgĭlĭus</orth>; the form Ver- is supported by the ancient MSS. and inscriptions in unbroken succession, to the fourth century A.D.; v. Ritschl, Opusc. Phil. 2, 779 sq.), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50545.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens; so, <cit><quote lang="la">esp., P. Vergilius Maro,</quote> <trans><tr>a celebrated Roman poet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 24, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 12, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 5, 40</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vergĭlĭ-ānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the poet Vergil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Vergilian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus, Plin. praef. § 22: illud,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">VERGILIANVS POËTA,</quote> <trans><tr>a writer of a cento of Vergilian verses</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 64, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vergo: <entryFree id="n50546" type="main" key="vergo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vergo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype> (<sense id="n50546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> wanting, acc. to Neue, Formenl. 2, pp. 507, 584; but versi is assumed as <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> by Prob. Cath. 1486, and is read, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:9:52" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 9, 52</bibl>, by Merkel, ex conj. for the MS. vertit; acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 3, 1, p. 218</bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 1, p. 366</bibl>, the <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> is verxi, but it does not occur in extant writings), <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n50546.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incline</hi>, <hi rend="ital">verge</hi> (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, and very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. inclino): in terras igitur quoque solis vergitur ardor, mid.,</quote> <trans><tr>turns itself</tr>, <tr>verges</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et polus aversi calidus quā vergitur Austri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Strongyle vergitur ad exortus solis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 6, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi imprudentes ipsi sibi saepe venenum Vergebant,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>turned in</tr>, <tr>poured in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1010" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1010</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in gelidos amoma sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:9:52" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 9, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spumantesque mero paterae verguntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:211" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 211</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 6, 244</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50546.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incline itself;</hi> of places, <hi rend="ital">to lie</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be situated</hi> in any direction (the class. signif. of the word; syn.: tendo, pertineo, jaceo). </sense><sense id="n50546.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab oppido declivis locus tenui fastigio vergebat in longitudinem passuum circiter quadringentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collis ad flumen Sabin,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> B.G. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galliae pars ad Septentriones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus in meridiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:31:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 31, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tectum aedium in tectum inferioris porticūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:4:section=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 4, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes partes in medium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> N.D. 2, 45, 116</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50546.4" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to turn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incline</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi Bruti auxilium ad Italiam vergere quam ad Asiam maluissemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illuc (i. e. in Tiberium) cuncta vergere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suam aetatem vergere,</quote> <trans><tr>that he was in the decline of his age</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed ne patriae quidem bonus tutor aut vindex est, si ad voluptates vergit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 15:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus nec ad recta fortiter nec ad prava vergentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tranq. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox vergit ad lucem,</quote> <trans><tr>verges towards</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:7:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vergente jam die,</quote> <trans><tr>declining</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 7</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">jam senecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vergens annis femina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegri vergentes in lethargum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 38, § 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colore languido in candidum vergente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 12, 26, § 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vergoanum: <entryFree id="n50547" type="main" key="Vergo^a_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vergŏānum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n50547.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town on the island of Lerina</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Gaul</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 11, § 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vergobretus: <entryFree id="n50548" type="main" key="Vergo^bre^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vergŏbrĕtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bergo/bretos</foreign>; <sense id="n50548.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">paraphr.,</quote> <trans><tr>the title of the chief magistrate among the Ædui</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vericola: <entryFree id="n50549" type="hapax" key="ve_ri^co^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vērĭcŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>verus-colo</etym>, <sense id="n50549.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cultivates</hi> or <hi rend="ital">regards the truth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carm. ad Senat. 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vericulum: <entryFree id="n50550" type="main" key="ve^ri^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕrĭcŭlum</orth> (not <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕrŭcŭlum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>veru; cf. corniculum, from cornu</etym>, <sense id="n50550.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small javelin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 6, 35, § 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:149" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 11, 41, § 149</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
veridice: <entryFree id="n50551" type="main" key="ve_ri^di^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vērĭdĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. veridicus <sense id="n50551.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
veridicentia: <entryFree id="n50552" type="main" key="ve_ri_di^centi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vērīdĭcentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>veridicus</etym>, <sense id="n50552.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">truthtelling</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. 1:14" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:2:2" default="NO">2, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
veridicus: <entryFree id="n50553" type="main" key="ve_ri^di^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vērĭdĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>verus-dico</etym>, <sense id="n50553.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that speaks the truth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">truth-telling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">veracious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">veridical</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n50553.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:45:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 45, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sorores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:1:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interpres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50553.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that is truly said; true</hi>, <hi rend="ital">veritable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">usus,</quote> <trans><tr>true experience</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 4, 6, § 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 16, 15, § 69</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vērĭdĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">truly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere (opp. rhetorice),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 17" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
veriloquium: <entryFree id="n50554" type="hapax" key="ve_ri^lo^qui^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vērĭlŏquĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>verus-loquor</etym>, a literal transl. of <foreign lang="greek">e)tumologi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n50554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">etymology</hi>, for which Cicero proposes the freer rendering, notatio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:8:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 8, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
veriloquus: <entryFree id="n50555" type="main" key="ve_ri^lo^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vērĭlŏquus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50555.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">speaking truly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">truth-telling</hi> (very rare): oraculum, <cb n="VERM" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 3:12" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 3, 12</bibl> Mai: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Ruf. 3, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
verisimilis: <entryFree id="n50556" type="main" key="ve_ri^si^mi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vērĭsĭmĭlis</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">vērĭsĭmĭlĭter</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">vērĭsĭmĭlĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>more correctly written separately</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">vērī sĭmĭlis</orth>, etc., v. under verus and similis, etc.</entryFree>
veritas: <entryFree id="n50557" type="main" key="ve_ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vērĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>verus</etym>, <sense id="n50557.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">truth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">truthfulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">verity; the true</hi> or <hi rend="ital">real nature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reality</hi> (always abstract; cf.: verum, vera). </sense><sense id="n50557.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">veritas, per quam immutata ea, quae sunt aut ante fuerunt aut futura sunt, dicuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:53:162" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 53, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritatem patefacere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:16:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 16, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentatio ... in quā perspicuam omnibus veritatem continet adsumptio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:36:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 36, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritatis cultores, fraudis inimici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 30, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o magna vis veritatis, quae ... facile se per se ipsa defendat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:26:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 26, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescio quo modo verum est quod in Andriā (1, 1, 41) familiaris meus dicit: obsequium amicos, veritas odium parit ... veritatem aspernere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:24:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 24, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil ad veritatem (loqui),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 25, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omni re vincit imitationem veritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:57:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 57, 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simplex ratio veritatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 53, 229</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50557.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n50557.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Reality</hi>, <hi rend="ital">real life</hi>, esp. of the likeness of life in works of art: <cit><quote lang="la">non intellegit Canachi signa rigidiora esse, quam ut imitentur veritatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:18:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 18, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mutum in simulacrum ex animali exemplo veritas transferatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratores sunt veritatis ipsius actores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:56:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 56, 214</bibl></cit>: haec tria genera exornationum perraro sumenda sunt, cum in veritate dicemus, <hi rend="ital">in reality</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in the forum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not for practice merely</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 22, 32</bibl>: vulgus ex veritate pauca, ex opinione multa aestimat, <hi rend="ital">according to truth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reality</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 10, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">salus omnium nostrum non veritate solum, sed etiam famā nititur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:1:section=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res et veritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:17:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 17, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exploranda est veritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 10, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50557.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Nature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the truth of nature</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic enim se profecto res habet, ut numquam perfecte veritatem casus imitetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:13:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 13, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere in se omnes numeros veritatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, quicquid accidat, id ex aeternā veritate causarumque continuatione fluxisse dicatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 20, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50557.5" n="3" level="3"> Consule veritatem, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the etymology</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">to\ e)/tumon</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:48:159" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 48, 159</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:8" default="NO">1, 7, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50557.6" n="4" level="3"> Of character, <hi rend="ital">truth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rectitude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">integrity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tuam fidem, veritatem, misericordiam confugit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sint veritatis et virtutis magistri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:3:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes obtinendae veritatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judiciorum religionem veritatemque perfringere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: si ad illam summam veritatem legitimum jus exegeris, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rustica Veritas,</quote> <trans><tr>truth</tr>, <tr>integrity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:72:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 72, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:84:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 84, 1</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n50557.7" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">veritates fortiter dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:7:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 7, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
veritus: <entryFree id="n50558" type="main" key="ve^ri^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕrĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of vereor.</entryFree>
veriverbium: <entryFree id="n50559" type="hapax" key="ve_ri^verbi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vērĭverbĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>verus-verbum</etym>, <sense id="n50559.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a telling the truth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">veracity</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vermesco: <entryFree id="n50560" type="main" key="vermesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vermesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> (eccl. Lat.), Aug. in Joan. tr. 35, 8.</entryFree>
vermiculate: <entryFree id="n50561" type="main" key="vermi^cu^la_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vermĭcŭlātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. vermiculor <sense id="n50561.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vermiculatio: <entryFree id="n50562" type="main" key="vermi^cu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vermĭcŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vermiculor</etym>, <sense id="n50562.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a being worm-eaten</hi>, of plants, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:24:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37</bibl>, §§ 218 and 230; 17, 11, 16, § 87.</sense></entryFree>
vermiculatus: <entryFree id="n50563" type="main" key="vermi^cu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vermĭcŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> of vermiculor.</entryFree>
vermiculor: <entryFree id="n50564" type="main" key="vermi^cu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vermĭcŭlor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n50564.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [vermiculus], <hi rend="ital">to be full of worms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wormy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be worm-eaten</hi>, of trees: <cit><quote lang="la">vermiculantur magis minusve quaedam arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 220</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">vermĭcŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">in the form of worms</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gummi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 21, 20, § 66</bibl></cit>.—Esp., of mosaic work, <hi rend="ital">inlaid so as to resemble the tracks of worms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vermiculated</hi>: pavimento atque emblemate vermiculato, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:44:149" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 44, 149</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crustae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>.—Of a quick movement of the finger, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 729</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vermĭcŭlātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a vermiculated manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tesserulas, ut ait Lucilius, struet, et vermiculate inter se lexeis committet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:113" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 113</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vermiculosus: <entryFree id="n50565" type="hapax" key="vermi^cu^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vermĭcŭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50565.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of worms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wormy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">poma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 12, 7, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vermiculus: <entryFree id="n50566" type="main" key="vermi^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vermĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>vermis</etym>, <sense id="n50566.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little worm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grub</hi>, in decaying things. </sense><sense id="n50566.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:899" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 899</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 65, 85, § 186</bibl>: <cb n="VERN" /> in linguā canum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 5, 32, § 100</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50566.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50566.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A disease of dogs which drives them mad</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 386</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50566.4" n="B" level="2"> In the Vulgate, <hi rend="ital">the scarlet worm</hi>, for coccum (<hi rend="ital">scarlet color</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:35:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 35, 25</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 64, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">VERMICVLVM STRAVERVNT,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4240</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> p. 114, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vermifluus: <entryFree id="n50567" type="hapax" key="vermi^flu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vermĭflŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vermisfluo</etym>, <sense id="n50567.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">swarming with worms</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 22, 134</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vermina: <entryFree id="n50568" type="main" key="vermi^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vermĭna</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vermis, gripings of the belly caused by worms; hence, in gen.</etym>, <sense id="n50568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the gripes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">belly-ache</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stomach-ache.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50568.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">saeva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:997" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 997</bibl></cit>; cf.: vermina dicuntur dolores corporis cum quodam minuto motu quasi a vermibus scindatur. Hic dolor Graece <foreign lang="greek">stro/fos</foreign> dicitur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=375" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 375</bibl> Müll. —* </sense><sense id="n50568.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">passionum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, p. 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
verminatio: <entryFree id="n50569" type="main" key="vermi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vermĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vermino</etym>, <sense id="n50569.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the worms</hi>, a disease of animals, <hi rend="ital">the bots.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50569.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 11, 49, § 180</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:144" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 15, 50, § 144</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n50569.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a crawling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">itching pain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 78:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 78, 9</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerebri aestuantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vermino: <entryFree id="n50570" type="main" key="vermi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vermĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype> (in the <sense id="n50570.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> collat. form verminatur, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 40, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>vermina</etym>. </sense><sense id="n50570.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to have worms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be troubled with worms</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:31:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 31, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50570.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to have crawling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">itching pains; to prick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shoot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ache</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:23:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 23, 1</bibl></cit>.— In the <hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> form: <cit><quote lang="la">si minus verminatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 17:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 17, 4</bibl></cit>.—Of women in labor: decumo mense demum turgens verminatur, parturit, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 40, 21</bibl> (Com. Rel. p. 198 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
verminosus: <entryFree id="n50571" type="main" key="vermi^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vermĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vermis</etym>, <sense id="n50571.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of worms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wormy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 28, 47, § 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulcera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 14, 87, § 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 14, 52, § 146</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vermis: <entryFree id="n50572" type="main" key="vermis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vermis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e(/lmis</foreign>; cf. Sanscr. krmis, worm; Goth. vaùrms, serpent</etym>, <sense id="n50572.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a worm</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:871" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 871</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:928" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 928</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:719" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 719</bibl>; 3, 723; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 17, 45, § 159</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:18" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 5, 11, § 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:114" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 13, 39, § 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:30" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
verna: <entryFree id="n50573" type="main" key="verna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">verna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>root vas, to dwell; Sanscr. vāstu, house; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)/stu</foreign>, city</etym>, <sense id="n50573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slave born in his master's house</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a homeborn slave.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50573.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vernas alere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 104</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:6:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 6, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:4:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 4, 3</bibl>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:65" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 2, 117</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 66</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">gen. fem.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1320</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Such slaves were trained up as buffoons or jesters,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:42:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 42, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 1:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 1, 6</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and v. vernilitas.—As a term of abuse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 4, 2, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50573.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a native</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de plebe Remi Numaeque verna, Jucundus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:76:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 76, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanos vernas appellabant, id est ibidem natos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=372" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 372</bibl></cit> Müll.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n50573.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ver-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">native</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:50:24" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 50, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:30:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 30, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuberes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:43:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 43, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liber,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>written in Rome</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:1:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vernaculus: <entryFree id="n50574" type="main" key="verna_cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vernācŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>verna</etym>. <sense id="n50574.0" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to verna, I.) <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to homeborn slaves.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50574.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudo,</quote> <trans><tr>the rabble of slaves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 31</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">plebs,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50574.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vernācŭli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (acc. to verna, I.), <hi rend="ital">buffoons</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jesters</hi> (postAug. and rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:3:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50574.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vernācŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a female household slave</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 804</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">filius quem susceperat ex vernaculā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Abrah. 1, 7, 65</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50574.4" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to verna, II.) <hi rend="ital">Native</hi>, <hi rend="ital">domestic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indigenous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vernacular</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Roman</hi> (the class. signif. of the word): <cit><quote lang="la">aquatilium vocabula partim sunt vernacula partim peregrina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=77" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 77</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 13, 77, § 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites (with peculiares),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">putatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imago antiquae et vernaculae festivitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapor,</quote> <trans><tr>inborn</tr>, <tr>innate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:46:172" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 46, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen domesticum ac vernaculum,</quote> <trans><tr>invented by the accuser himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:61:section=141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 61, § 141</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 105</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50574.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Natural</hi>, <hi rend="ital">common</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">paupertas olim philosophiae vernacula est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 18, p. 285, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
