<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:37" default="NO">21, 1, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
veteratorie: <entryFree id="n50752" type="main" key="ve^te^ra_to_ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtĕrātōrĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. veteratorius <sense id="n50752.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
veteratorius: <entryFree id="n50753" type="main" key="ve^te^ra_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtĕrātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>veterator, II. A.</etym>, <sense id="n50753.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">crafty. cunning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sly</hi> (Ciceronian): <cit><quote lang="la">nihil ab isto tectum, nihil veteratorium exspectaveritis: omnia aperta, omnia perspicua reperientur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:54:section=141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 54, § 141</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ratio dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:75:261" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 75, 261</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtĕrātōrĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">craftily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cunningly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slyly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere (with acute),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:28:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 28, 99</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
veteratrix: <entryFree id="n50754" type="hapax" key="ve^te^ra_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtĕrātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>veterator</etym>, <sense id="n50754.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sorceress</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 230, 24</bibl> (al. veratrix).</sense></entryFree>
veteratus: <entryFree id="n50755" type="main" key="ve^te^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtĕrātus</orth>, <pos>P. a.</pos> of vetero.</entryFree>
veteretum: <entryFree id="n50756" type="main" key="ve^te^re_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtĕrētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vetus</etym>, <sense id="n50756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ground that has long lain fallow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">old fallow ground</hi>, = vervactum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 4</bibl> and 5; 2, 13, 2.</sense></entryFree>
veterinarius: <entryFree id="n50757" type="main" key="ve^te^ri_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtĕrīnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>veterinus</etym>, <sense id="n50757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to beasts of burden and draught.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50757.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicina,</quote> <trans><tr>farriery</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50757.2" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n50757.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtĕrīnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a cattle-doctor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">farrier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">veterinarian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:8:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:14" default="NO">7, 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:12" default="NO">11, 1, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50757.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtĕ-rīnārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a place for taking care of diseased animals</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Grom. p. 12" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Grom. p. 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
veterinus: <entryFree id="n50758" type="main" key="ve^te^ri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtĕrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contr. from vehiterinus, from veho; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=369" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 369</bibl> Müll.</etym>, <sense id="n50758.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to carrying</hi> or <hi rend="ital">drawing burdens.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50758.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: bestia, <hi rend="ital">a beast of burden</hi> or <hi rend="ital">draught</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=369" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 369</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also pecus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 46, 106, § 255</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence also: semen equorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:890" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 890</bibl></cit> (887); so, <cit><quote lang="la">semen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:865" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 865</bibl></cit> (862).—</sense><sense id="n50758.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtĕrīnae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕ-tĕrīna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">draught-cattle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beasts of burden</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:38:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 38, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 64, § 168</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:265" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 50, 111, § 265</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50758.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to beasts of burden</hi>: ars, <hi rend="ital">the art of healing domestic animals</hi>, Veg. Vet. praef. 1.</sense></entryFree>
veternositas: <entryFree id="n50759" type="hapax" key="ve^terno_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕternōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>veternosus</etym>, <sense id="n50759.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lethargy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">somnolency</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 3, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
veternosus: <entryFree id="n50760" type="main" key="ve^terno_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕternōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>veternus, II. C.</etym>, <sense id="n50760.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">afflicted with lethargy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lethargic.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50760.1" n="I" level="1"> <cb n="VETO" /> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 4, 13, § 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:230" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 17, 67, § 230</bibl>; Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:15:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 15, 9</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=369" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 369</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n50760.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">sleepy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drowsy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dreamy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50760.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">languid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spiritless</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:16:25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 16, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus dicendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 48" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 48</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">veternosissimi artificii nodos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 82:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 82, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
veternus: <entryFree id="n50761" type="main" key="ve^ternus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕternus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vetus</etym>, <sense id="n50761.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of great age</hi>, <hi rend="ital">old</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ancient</hi> (only post-class.). </sense><sense id="n50761.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 1 praef.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 9, 68</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50761.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕter-nus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> * </sense><sense id="n50761.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Old age</hi>, <hi rend="ital">age</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:94" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 94</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50761.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Old dirt</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 223</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50761.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Lethargy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">somnolence</hi> (as a disease of aged people). </sense><sense id="n50761.6" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">num eum veternus aut aqua intercus tenet?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Of the deep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">long sleep</hi> or <hi rend="ital">torpidity</hi> of bears, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 36, 54, § 127</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50761.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">drowsiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sluggishness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sloth</hi> (freq., but not in Cic.), Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 6, 4</bibl> (cited ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 13, 3</bibl>); <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:17:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 17, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:10:4" default="NO">7, 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 3, p. 357</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n50762" type="main" key="ve^ternus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕternus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. 1. veternus, II.</entryFree>
vetero: <entryFree id="n50763" type="main" key="ve^te^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>vetus</etym>, <sense id="n50763.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make old</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">dicendo autem novum veteravit prius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 8, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕ-tĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">old</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inveterate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mederi ulceribus veteratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 52, § 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caseus,</quote> <trans><tr>mouldy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 140" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 140</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vetitum: <entryFree id="n50764" type="main" key="ve^ti^tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. veto <sense id="n50764.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vetitus: <entryFree id="n50765" type="main" key="ve^ti^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of veto.</entryFree>
veto: <entryFree id="n50766" type="main" key="ve^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕto</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 1</itype> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏto</orth>: <sense id="n50766.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">votes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">votitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 4, 1, 44</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 45, 4</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and late Lat.) vetavit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:90" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetati sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 16, 6</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">not to suffer</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">to take place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not to permit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to advise against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oppose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forbid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prohibit</hi> a thing; and, with a personal object, <hi rend="ital">not to permit</hi> one <hi rend="ital">to do</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">to prevent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hinder</hi> him <hi rend="ital">from doing</hi> it, <hi rend="ital">not to grant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to forbid</hi> him a thing, etc. (syn.: interdico, inhibeo); constr. most freq. with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, less freq. with the simple <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, the simple <case>acc.</case>, with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, or the simple <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50766.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n50766.2" n="a" level="4"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex peregrinum vetat in murum ascendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:24:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 24, 100</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (lex naturae) vetat ullam rem esse cujusquam, nisi ejus, qui tractare et uti sciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 17, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab opere legatos Caesar discedere vetuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationes a te collectae vetabant, me rei publicae penitus diffidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ridentem dicere verum Quid vetat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non me ulla vetabunt Frigora Parthenios canibus circumdare saltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos vetuit me numerare timor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:29" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 29</bibl></cit> (3, 27), 4; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 32 (3, 30), 8: cum leges duo ex unā familiā non solum magistratus creari vetarent, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra ... vallo muniri vetuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (lex) de capite civis Romani nisi comitiis centuriatis statui vetaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:36:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 36, 61</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum equites Romani flere pro me edictis vetarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,018:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Red. Quir. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sterni vetabere terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:647" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 647</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nolani muros portasque adire vetiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 16, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">redemptoribus vetitis frumentum parare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut a praefecto morum Hasdrubal cum eo vetaretur esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,022:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ham. 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:470" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 470</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:371" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 371</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50766.3" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, or the simple <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">sive jubebat, Ut faceret quid, Sive vetabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edicto vetuit, ne quis se praeter Apellen Pingeret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 239</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 187</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetabo, qui Cereris sacrum Vulgarit arcanae, sub isdem Sit trabibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 2, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:6:36" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 6, 36</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50766.4" n="c" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">quin</hi> (ante- and postclass. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">nemo hinc prohibet nec votat, Quin quod palam'st venale, emas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1</bibl>, praef. 17.—</sense><sense id="n50766.5" n="d" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">quominus</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">at haec (sapientiā) nullā re, quo minus se exerceat, vetari potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50766.6" n="e" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">tabulae peccare vetantes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec laevus vetet ire picus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 27, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde proferre pedem pudor vetet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 135</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:91:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 91, 1</bibl>: quid vetat? with a foll. <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 7, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:295" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 295</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ait esse vetitum intro ad eram accedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 6</bibl></cit> (7), 24.—</sense><sense id="n50766.7" n="f" level="4"> With <case>acc.</case> </sense><sense id="n50766.8" n="(a)" level="5"> Of the thing: <cit><quote lang="la">quia bella vetabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec majora veto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:541" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 541</bibl></cit>: quid jubeatve vetetve, id. M. <pb n="1983" /> <cb n="VETU" /> 11, 493: <cit><quote lang="la">iter mediis natura vetabat Syrtibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristia damna vetabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:173" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 173</bibl></cit>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:304" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 304</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solem vetuit Delia tardior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 150" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quercus Phoebum vetat,</quote> <trans><tr>keeps off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 1624" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1624</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossam praeduxit, quā incerta Oceani vetarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ludere) vetitā legibus aleā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetiti hymenaei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:623" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 623</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetitae terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:4:21" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factum vetitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 9, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetito ponto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1585" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1585</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50766.9" n="(b)" level="5"> Of the person: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Graecos facerem Versiculos, vetuit me tali voce Quirinus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos vetat igne Creon,</quote> <trans><tr>keeps off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:558" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 558</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acta agimus: quod vetamur vetere proverbio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:22:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 22, 85</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vetustissimi mortalium nihil per metum vetabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter eandem causam facere debebimus, propter quam vetamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:65" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe vetor fatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mathematici, genus hominum, quod in civitate nostrā et vetabitur semper et retinebitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50766.10" n="g" level="4"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex omnis aut jubet aut vetat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:5:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: optat supremo collocare Sisyphus In monte saxum; <cit><quote lang="la">sed vetant leges Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:69" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res ipsa vetat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:354" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 354</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a patria pelago vela vetante datis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 13, 128</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 131</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50766.11" n="II" level="1"> In partic.: veto, <hi rend="ital">I forbid it</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I protest;</hi> the word with which the tribunes of the people declared their protest against any measure of the Senate or of the magistrates, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 13, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:35:9" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 35, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vim fieri vetarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:12:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 12, 9</bibl></cit>.—Of the protest of the praetor against any unlawful measure, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 13, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:1:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 1, 14</bibl>. —And in the lang. of augury: <cit><quote lang="la">vetat haruspex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:38:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 38, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si vetet auspicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:764" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 764</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n50766.12" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That which is forbidden</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prohibited</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a forbidden</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prohibited thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitimur in vetitum semper cupimusque negata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed jam de vetito quisque parabat opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:282" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 282</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venerem In vetitis numerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 435</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebrescit occultis primum sermonibus, ut vetita solent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agebat quaedam vetita legibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 6, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50766.13" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A prohibition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussa ac vetita populorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae contra vetitum discordia?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vettius: <entryFree id="n50767" type="main" key="Vettius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vettius</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vat. 10, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vettones: <entryFree id="n50768" type="main" key="Vetto_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vettōnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, v. Vectones.</entryFree>
vettonica: <entryFree id="n50769" type="main" key="vetto^ni^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vettŏnĭca</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">beto-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the betony</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 46, § 84</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vetulonia: <entryFree id="n50770" type="main" key="Ve^tu^lo_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕtŭlōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Etruria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:485" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 485</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n50770.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕtŭlōnĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Vetulonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 227</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50770.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vetŭlōnĭenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Vetulonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vetulus: <entryFree id="n50771" type="main" key="ve^tu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n50771.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [vetus], <hi rend="ital">little old</hi>, <hi rend="ital">old</hi> (class.) </sense><sense id="n50771.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetulus, decrepitus senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 7, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 29, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 19, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor (opp. novella),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:14:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 14, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Falernum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:13:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 13, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">cadi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:112:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 112, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n50771.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50771.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a little old man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 4</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Jocularly: mi vetule,</quote> <trans><tr>my little old fellow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 16, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50771.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a little old woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:241" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 241</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:79:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 79, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
veturius: <entryFree id="n50772" type="main" key="Veturi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Veturĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Veturĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n50772.1" n="1" level="3"> L. Veturius Philo, <hi rend="ital">a consul</hi> 548 A.U.C., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:14:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 14, 57</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50772.2" n="2" level="3"> T. Veturius Calvinus, <hi rend="ital">a consul</hi> 433 A.U.C., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:30:109" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 30, 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:12:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 12, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 8, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Veturia,</quote> <trans><tr>the mother of Coriolanus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:40:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 40, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vetus: <entryFree id="n50773" type="main" key="ve^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtus</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype> (ante-class. collat. form of the <sense id="n50773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. sing.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕter</orth>, Enn. and Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 607</bibl> P.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 2</bibl> Müll.; <case>abl.</case> regularly, vetere; <cit><quote lang="la">but veteri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:121" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 121</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:360" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 360</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 582</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 374</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> class. vetustior; archaic form veterior), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. vatsas, year; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)/tos, vetos</foreign></etym>. </sense><sense id="n50773.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n50773.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Old</hi> (opp. young), <hi rend="ital">aged</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Acherunticus senex, vetus, decrepitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novus amator, vetus puer,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteres ac moris antiqui memores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 27, 4</bibl></cit>: veteres et sancti viri, <cb n="VETU" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 2, 23, 5</bibl> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">parentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:576" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 576</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 53, 74, § 146</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:513" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 513</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:42" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8, 42</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n50773.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Old</hi> (opp. new), <hi rend="ital">of long standing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam veterrumu'st, tam homini optimu'st amicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maceria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 50</bibl></cit>: Antemna veterior est Romā, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 716</bibl> P. (Orig. 1, fr. 25): quod si veteris contumeliae oblivisci vellet; <cit><quote lang="la">num etiam recentium injuriarum memoriam deponere posse?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidia et infamia non recens, sed vetus ac diuturna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus atque usitata exceptio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:37:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 37, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sphaerae illius vetus esse inventum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 14, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amici veteres (opp. novi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:18:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 18, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veterrima (amicitia),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 23, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provinciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:44:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 44, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:39:8" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 39, 8</bibl>.—Esp., of soldiers, <hi rend="ital">veteran</hi>, <hi rend="ital">experienced</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille exercitatus et vetus (miles),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:16:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 16, 38</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 8, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">copiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:41:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 41, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 8, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centuriones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:17:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 17, 10</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">gnaros belli veteresque laborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:532" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 532</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scientiae et caerimoniarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operis ac laboris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:297" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 297</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">hinc Fadum petit et veterem bellare Labicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:565" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 565</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50773.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Old</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of a former time</hi> (opp. present, existing), <hi rend="ital">former</hi>, <hi rend="ital">earlier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ancient</hi>, etc. (cf. antiquus): <cit><quote lang="la">veterem atque antiquam rem novam ad vos proferam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">historia vetus atque antiqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 100</bibl></cit> Brix ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">credendum est veteribus et priscis, ut aiunt, viris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veterrimi poëtae Stoici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:15:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 15, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo vetustior et horridior ille (Laelius) quam Scipio,</quote> <trans><tr>archaic</tr>, <tr>antiquated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:21:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 21, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in veterem revoluta figuram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:449" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 449</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama veterum malorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 527</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 21, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50773.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50773.6" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtĕres</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the ancients</hi>, <hi rend="ital">men of a former time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the fathers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ancestors</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forefathers</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">majores nostri, veteres illi, admodum antiqui, leges annales non habebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:17:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 17, 47</bibl></cit>.—Esp., of ancient authors, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri veteres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 7, 12, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae veteres factitarunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:prol. 43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. prol. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes veteres et Cicero praecipue,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:4:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiqui veteres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad Amic. 1:5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad Amic. 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50773.7" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtĕres</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. tabernae), <hi rend="ital">the old booths</hi> on the south side of the Forum Romanum (opp. Novae, v. novus): <cit><quote lang="la">sub Veteribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 16, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 4, 8, § 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50773.8" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtĕra</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the old</hi>, <hi rend="ital">old things</hi>, <hi rend="ital">antiquity</hi> (opp. praesentia): <cit><quote lang="la">vetera semper in laude, praesentia in fastidio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si vetera mihi ignota (sunt),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:18:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 18, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetera omittere,</quote> <trans><tr>to leave out of consideration</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 102:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 102, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetera odisse, nova optare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 37, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetera scrutari,</quote> <trans><tr>traditions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:13:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 13, 29</bibl></cit>. —Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">vetera vaticinamini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 129</bibl></cit> Lorenz ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
vetusculus: <entryFree id="n50774" type="main" key="ve^tuscu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtuscŭlus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n50774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [vetus], <hi rend="ital">somewhat old</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ancient</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oldish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rather antiquated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Eloqu. p. 232" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Eloqu. p. 232</bibl></cit> Mai: <cit><quote lang="la">dictio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vetustas: <entryFree id="n50775" type="main" key="ve^tustas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtustas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">old age</hi>, <hi rend="ital">age</hi>, <hi rend="ital">long existence.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50775.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50775.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">municipium vetustate antiquissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetustate possessionis se, non jure defendunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:21:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 21, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum aevi longinqua valet mutare vetustas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:415" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 415</bibl></cit>: tum senior: quamvis obstet mihi tarda vetustas; <cit><quote lang="la">Multaque me fugiant, etc., = senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 182</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae familiarnm vetustatibus aut pecuniis ponderantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:31:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 31, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50775.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">ancient times</hi>, <hi rend="ital">antiquity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">historia nuntia vetustatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 9, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra omnia vetustatis exempla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tantā vetustate non rerum modo sed etiam auctorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetustatem in majus componens,</quote> <trans><tr>exaggerating</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 60</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">judicio vetustatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:72" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic credidit alta vetustas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:26" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50775.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50775.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Long duration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">great age</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae mihi videntur habitura etiam vetustatem,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>will have a long duration</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripta vetustatem si modo nostra ferent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:9:8" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 9, 8</bibl></cit>: vinum in vetustatem servare, <hi rend="ital">till it becomes</hi> <cb n="VEXA" /> <hi rend="ital">old</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acquires age</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 114, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terebinthi materies fidelis ad vetustatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 6, 12, § 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjuncti vetustate, officiis, benevolentiā,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>long intimacy</tr>, <tr>ancient friendship</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 32, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Pet. Cons. 5:16" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Pet. Cons. 5, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50775.6" n="B" level="2"> Hence, <hi rend="ital">posterity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the remote future</hi> (conceived as a time when this age will have become ancient): <cit><quote lang="la">de me semper omnes gentes loquentur, nulla umquam obmutescet vetustas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:35:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 35, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qua fidem tanto est operi latura vetustas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:792" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 792</bibl></cit> Ladew. and Forbig. ad loc.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quis hoc credat, nisi sit pro teste vetustas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:400" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 400</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50775.7" n="C" level="2"> In medic. lang.: <cit><quote lang="la">ulcerum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>inveterate ulcers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 19, 74, § 127</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vetuste: <entryFree id="n50776" type="main" key="ve^tuste_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtustē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. vetustus <sense id="n50776.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vetustesco: <entryFree id="n50777" type="main" key="ve^tustesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtustesco</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-tisco</orth> acc. to Nigid. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 437, 27</bibl>), ĕre, <sense id="n50777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [vetustus], <hi rend="ital">to grow old</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vetustus: <entryFree id="n50778" type="main" key="ve^tustus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtustus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vetus</etym>, <sense id="n50778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has existed a long time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">old</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ancient</hi> (in the <hi rend="ital">posit.</hi> mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, and almost exclusively of things; for the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> vetustior, v. vetus): <cit><quote lang="la">veteris vetusti (vini) cupida sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templum Cereris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:713" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 713</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:360" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 360</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:521" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 521</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:43" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 284</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornicum saecla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1084" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1084</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium aetatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 1174</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:774" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 774</bibl>, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:827" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 827</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 36, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:3:11" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:642" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 642</bibl></cit>.—Of a person: <cit><quote lang="la">vetusto nobilis ab Lamo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 17, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:23:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ova,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 16, 30, § 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 19, 73, § 124</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepulcra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instrumentum imperii,</quote> <trans><tr>ancient records of the State</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 8</bibl></cit>.—Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">qui vetustissimus ex iis, qui viverent, censoriis esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:22:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 22, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: vetustissimus liberorum. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 32</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtustē</orth>. * </sense><sense id="n50778.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">After the manner of the ancients</hi>, Ascon. ad. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 13</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n50778.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">From ancient times</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetustissime in usu est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 7, 28, § 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vexabilis: <entryFree id="n50779" type="main" key="vexa_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vexābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vexo</etym>. <sense id="n50779.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Disturbed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plagued</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vexed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 5, 10</bibl></cit> Bünem. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n50779.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Causing annoyance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">troublesome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vexatious</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:11:78" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 11, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:2:9:39" default="NO">2, 9, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vexabiliter: <entryFree id="n50780" type="main" key="vexa_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vexābĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>vexabilis, II.</etym>, <sense id="n50780.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">troublesomely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vexatiously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput onerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:9:41" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 9, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vexamen: <entryFree id="n50781" type="hapax" key="vexa_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vexāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vexo</etym>, <sense id="n50781.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quaking</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 340</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vexata: <entryFree id="n50782" type="main" key="vexa_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vexāta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. vexo, II. A. b.</entryFree>
vexatio: <entryFree id="n50783" type="main" key="vexa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vexātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vexo</etym>, <sense id="n50783.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a violent movement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shaking.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50783.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">partus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 19, 77, § 253</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minima pomorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsā enim vexatione constringitur (arbor) et radices certius figit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 4:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 4, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50783.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">agitation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi agitetur (virtus), nisi assiduā vexatione roboretur, non potest esse perfecta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 29, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50783.3" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">discomfort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annoyance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hardship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distress; trouble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vexation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:8:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:48:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 48, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omni genere vexationis processerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:3:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stomachi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 6, 35, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes sine vexatione extrahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:791" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 7, 26, § 791</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut virgines Vestales ex acerbissimā vexatione eriperem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vexatio direptioque sociorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per vexationem et contumelias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:59:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 59, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multā cum vexatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:4:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine magnā vexatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:5:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 5, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50783.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Persecution</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. 1, 1, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vexativus: <entryFree id="n50784" type="main" key="vexa_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vexātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50784.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">causing annoyance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vexatious</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:29:156" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 29, 156</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:4:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 3, 4, 63</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vexator: <entryFree id="n50785" type="main" key="vexa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vexātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50785.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a troubler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harasser</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abuser</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vexer</hi> (Ciceron.): <cit><quote lang="la">custosne urbis an direptor et vexator esset Antonius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetatulae suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furoris (Clodii),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>opposer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 13, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vexatrix: <entryFree id="n50786" type="main" key="vexa_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vexātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vexator</etym>, <sense id="n50786.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that vexes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">molests</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 29, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">libido vexatrix hominum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vexatus: <entryFree id="n50787" type="main" key="vexa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vexātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. vexo, II. A. <sense id="n50787.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> <pb n="1984" /> <cb n="VIA" /></sense></entryFree>
vexillarius: <entryFree id="n50788" type="main" key="vexilla_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vexillārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vexillum</etym>. <sense id="n50788.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A standard-bearer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ensign.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50788.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50788.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a leader</hi>, <hi rend="ital">captain</hi> of a band of robbers, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 146</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50788.3" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vexillārĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, in the times of the emperors, <hi rend="ital">the oldest class of veterans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the last summoned</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 83</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 100</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 110 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.</sense></entryFree>
vexillatio: <entryFree id="n50789" type="main" key="vexilla_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vexillātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n50789.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A body of the</hi> vexillarii; acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">a body of soldiers united under one flag</hi> (vexillum), <hi rend="ital">a corps</hi>, <hi rend="ital">battalion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 845</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2009</bibl> sq. al.—</sense><sense id="n50789.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A division of cavalry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a troop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">squadron</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 191, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vexillifer: <entryFree id="n50790" type="main" key="vexilli^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vexillĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vexillumfero</etym>, <sense id="n50790.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">standard-bearing</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 419</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vexillum: <entryFree id="n50791" type="main" key="vexillum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vexillum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym><lbl>dim.</lbl> of vēlum</etym>, <sense id="n50791.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a military ensign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">standard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">banner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flag.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50791.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:40:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 40, 102</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 11, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:32:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 32, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:20 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 20 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n50791.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a red flag</hi> placed on the general's tent, as a signal for marching or for battle: vexillum proponere, <hi rend="ital">to raise</hi> or <hi rend="ital">display</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vexillo signum dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 89 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n50791.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the troops belonging to a</hi> vexillum, <hi rend="ital">a company</hi>, <hi rend="ital">troop</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:782" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 782</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50791.4" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:2:43" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 2, 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vexo: <entryFree id="n50792" type="main" key="vexo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vexo</orth> (<sense id="n50792.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> vexarier, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 480</bibl>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>veho</etym>, orig., <hi rend="ital">to shake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jolt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">toss</hi> in carrying; hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to move violently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agitate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50792.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare; syn. quatio): vexasse grave verbum est, factumque ab eo videtur, quod est vehere; <cit><quote lang="la">in quo inest jam vis quaedam alieni arbitrii. Non enim sui potens est, qui vehitur. Vexare autem, quod ex eo inclinatum est, vi atque motu procul dubio vastiore est. Nam qui fertur et raptatur atque huc atque illuc distrahitur, is vexari proprie dicitur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:6:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(rector) per confragosa vexabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:41:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 41, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigia in summum veniant vexata periclum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:430" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 430</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dulichias vexasse rates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis vexata est tempestate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:79:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 79, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(venti vis) montes supremos Silvifragis vexat flabris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 275</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti caeli nubila vexant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 435</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in turbā vexatus,</quote> <trans><tr>tossed back and forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruina cum clade vexatarum regionum (of an earthquake),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 17, 1, 3</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n50792.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to injure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">damage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">molest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annoy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plague</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trouble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maltreat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vex</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disquiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torment</hi>, etc. (syn.: ango, crucio, vasto, the predom. signif. of the word). </sense><sense id="n50792.3" n="A" level="2"> Physically: cum Hannibal terram Italiam laceraret atque vexaret, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:6:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 6, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agros vectigales vexatos et exinanitos a Verre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:52:section=122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 52, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Siciliam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 3, 54, § 125: omnem Galliam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agros,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 15</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 11, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem publicam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Amanienses hostes sempiternos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:31 al" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 31 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vexati omnes difficultate viae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:22:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 22, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:55:3" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 55, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vexato exercitu descendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:30:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 30, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos et ipsos ... locorum asperitas hostiliter vexavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 43, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 5, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (stomachum) umor vexat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 8, 32, § 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fauces (tussis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:86:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 86, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites frigore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes percussu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 11, 49, § 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestem solo,</quote> <trans><tr>to rumple</tr>, <tr>disorder</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rosas,</quote> <trans><tr>to crush</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:89:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 89, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comas,</quote> <trans><tr>to twist</tr>, <tr>frizzle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 14, 24</bibl></cit>.—In mal. part.: <cit><quote lang="la">maritum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:46:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 46, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:81:1" default="NO">11, 81, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 139</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 108</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50792.4" n="b" level="4"> In the <hi rend="ital">part. perf. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vexāta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">injured parts of the body</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">injuries</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7 praef.</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 27, 41, § 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 101" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 101</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50792.5" n="B" level="2"> Mentally: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem probris maledictisque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 20, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Quinctius) multis vexatus contumeliis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 31, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem honestissimis contentionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem iis verbis, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:28:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 28, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vexatur Theophrastus et libris et scholis omnium philosophorum,</quote> <trans><tr>is attacked</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:9:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 9, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitudo vexat impios,</quote> <trans><tr>disquiets</tr>, <tr>torments</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:14:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 14, 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ita conscientia mentem excitam vexabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me honoris cupido vexabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentem mariti philtris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:611" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 611</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
